title: Tracking the path of Tropical Storm Lee
description: We’re tracking the path of Hurricane Lee

title: India’s ruling Hindu nationalists push ‘Bharat’ as country’s name
description: On invitations to G-20 summit leaders, the government of Prime Minister Narendra Modi referred to the host nation as “Bharat” instead of “India.”

title: Ukrainian lawmakers reinstate disclosure rule to fight graft, with a catch
description: Ukraine’s parliament reinstated an asset disclosure rule intended to combat public corruption, but then delayed its implementation for a year, a move that could draw questions from the West.

title: German court refuses extradition to U.K. based on prison conditions
description: The unusual German court ruling is an embarrassment for post-Brexit Britain.

title: Cuba says human traffickers luring citizens to Russia’s war on Ukraine
description: “Cuba has a firm and clear historical position against mercenarism,” Cuban Foreign Minister Bruno Rodriguez said in a statement.

title: Air Canada passengers removed for refusing to sit on vomit-soiled seats
description: The airline has apologized to the two women who were taken off a flight from Las Vegas to Montreal last month.

title: Workers seeking shortcut carve hole in China’s Great Wall, police say
description: Authorities in China arrested two people they said had inflicted “irreversible” damage to the country’s Great Wall by razing a section in Shanxi province.

title: Kharkiv’s subways are now classrooms as school starts under Russian attacks
description: Russia’s war against Ukraine has destroyed more than 1,300 schools. In Kharkiv, amid constant airstrikes, some children will now attend classes in the relative safety of subway stations.

title: Schools in England could collapse due to weak concrete: What to know
description: Just as the British school year is beginning, the government says at least 156 schools are at risk since they were built with RAAC, a cheaper concrete.

title: ‘Steak’ and ‘ham’ labels on plant-based foods? France says non.
description: France hopes to ban vegan foodmakers from using words like steak, ham, and fillet to describe plant-based proteins, following similar bans in several U.S. states.

title: Hong Kong court hands rare victory to advocates of same sex unions
description: The surprise ruling, which stopped short of meeting demands for full marriage equality, stated that the Hong Kong had to grant gay citizens some kind of alternative framework.

title: North Korea, the original Hermit Kingdom, slowly reopens after covid
description: North Korea’s airline has resumed flights to China and rail passenger services across the border after 43 months of total isolation. Kim Jong Un may even visit Russia.

title: Trial begins for leaders of Ottawa-jamming ‘Freedom Convoy’ truck protests
description: Tamara Lich and Chris Barber face charges including mischief and intimidation for their roles in the demonstrations that paralyzed Canada’s capital and inspired copycats around the world.

title: Spike in Asian hornet sightings could be deadly for British bees, experts say
description: Asian hornets, which eat honeybees and threaten crops, are on a path to becoming established in Britain after invading mainland Europe, experts say.

title: Australia mounts rescue of ill Antarctic worker with icebreaker, helicopters
description: The icebreaker RSV Nuyina traveled more than 1,860 miles near the end of the bitter Antarctic winter season to get close to Australia’s Casey research station.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Kim and Putin planning talks on potential arms deal, U.S. officials say
description: The North Korean leader is planning to visit Russia this month, senior administration officials told The Post, as Moscow looks to bolster its fight in Ukraine.

title: Doctors left dinner-plate-sized tool in woman after C-section, report says
description: New Zealand’s health and disability commissioner ruled that medical group Te Whatu Ora left a surgical device in a patient’s abdomen after a C-section.

title: China’s Xi fights fires at home and abroad
description: Facing issues at home and abroad, Chinese President Xi Jinping’s apparent approach to the moment is to double down on his hard-line nationalist instincts.
